ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies to insert a blank line after every n observations.
      
Syntax: 
(1) BLANKLINE= n 
(2)BLANKLINE= (COUNT=n <STYLE= [style-attibute-specification(s)]>)

[Syntax: CONTENTS=link-text] 
      
Specifies the text for the links in the HTML contents file to the output produced 
by the PROC PRINT statement.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the SAS data set to print.
Writes a blank line between observations.
Controls the orientation of the column headings.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Prints all column headings vertically.                                   Beginning in SAS 9.3, for the LISTING destination, if HEADING=V, the variable name   is used in place of a label if the column heading is too long for the page.    Also, for all destinations other than the LISTING destination, if HEADING=V,   the size of the column label is no longer restricted by the page size specified   for the LISTING destination.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Uses variables' labels as column headings.

Syntax: N<="string-1" <"string-2">>
      
Prints the number of observations in the data set, in BY groups, or both and specifies explanatory 
text to print with the number.

Syntax: N<="string-1" <"string-2">>
      
Prints the number of observations in the data set, in BY groups, or both and specifies explanatory 
text to print with the number.
Suppresses the observation number in the output.

[Syntax: OBS="column-header"] 
      
Specifies a column heading for the column that identifies each observation by number.
Rounds unformatted numeric values to two decimal places.

[Syntax: ROWS= page-format] 
      
Formats rows on a page. Currently, PAGE is the only value that you can use for page-format.

Beginning in SAS 9.3, ROWS= is valid only for the LISTING destination.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to format rows on a page.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SPLIT='split-character'] 
      
Specifies the split character, which controls line breaks in column headings.

Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
      
Specifies the style element to use for the specified locations in the report.

Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
      
Specifies the style element to use for the specified locations in the report.

Specifies to use the variable label, if it exists, as the label on the summary line in place
of the variable name.

Specifies leave the label on the summary line blank. Alternatively, you can use SUMLABEL="" 
(two single or double quotation marks with no space between them) to indicate a blank on the 
summary line.
Determines the column width for each variable.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses a variable's formatted width as the column width.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Uses for each variable the minimum column width that accommodates all values  of the variable.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Uses each variable's formatted width as its column width on all pages.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Formats all columns uniformly within a BY group, using each variable's formatted  width as its column width.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: GRANDTOTAL_LABEL='label'] 
      
Displays a label on the grand total line. You can include the #BYVAR and #BYVAL variables in 'label'.

[Syntax: SUMLABEL='label'] 
      
Specifies the text to use as a label on the summary line of a BY group. You can include the #BYVAR 
and #BYVAL variables in 'label'. 

Restriction: The #BYVAR and #BYVAL variables are not supported for the LISTING destination.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
Produces a separate section of the report for each BY group.

Beginning in SAS 9.3, the following enhancements/changes are introduced:

o If you specify a BY variable whose values are not sorted, SAS stops printing and 
  writes a message to the log. 

o Each BY group is a separate table and the observation counts is reset to zero at 
  the beginning of each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAGEBY BY-variable;] 
      
Controls page ejects that occur before a page is full.

[Syntax: SUMBY BY-variable;] 
      
Limits the number of sums that appear in the report.

Identifies observations by using the formatted values of the variables that you 
list instead of by using observation numbers.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for ID columns created with the ID statement.

Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for ID columns created with the ID statement.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: VAR variable(s) </ STYLE <(location(s))> =<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>>; 
      
Selects variables that appear in the report and determines their order.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for all columns that are created by a VAR statement.

Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for all columns that are created by a VAR statement.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SUM variable(s) </ STYLE <(location(s))> =<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>>; 
      
Totals values of numeric variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for cells containing sums that are created 
with the SUM statement.

Syntax: STYLE <(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for cells containing sums that are created 
with the SUM statement.
